author: jstrachan
msg: Added support for Jelly Stylesheet Language tags (JSL) which are an implementation of an XSLT style declarative transformation engine.
The whole thing uses 3 tags, <jsl:stylesheet>, <jsl:template> and <jsl:applyTemplates> that work neatly with the XML taglib from JSTL.
This allows XSLT like processing to be cleanly mixed with JSTL tags in a single Jelly script; also JSL is totally dynamic, so the stylesheet can be dynamically created and invoked.
There are example targets demo.jsl and demo.jsl2 that demonstrate JSL in action

author: jstrachan
msg: Restored previous home page that was changed to messenger's home page by accident! Whoops

author: jstrachan
msg: Build and unit tests all seem to work fine now. The LinkageError that was occurring on the unit tests has now gone away; the trick is not to put any JAXP / Xerces related dependencies in project.xml

author: jstrachan
msg: Patched the code from suggestion by James Elson that setContext() should occur before any setter method. Nice one James E, thanks!

author: jstrachan
msg: Patched the createExpression() method so that any TagLibrary implementaiton will get default Expression behaviour. This logic was mistakenly added to the CoreTagLibrary rather than TagLibrary by accident.
